info.title: Lightdash API
info.description: Open API documentation for all public Lightdash API endpoints.  # Authentication Before you get started, you might need to create a Personal Access Token to authenticate via the API. You can create a token by following this guide: https://docs.lightdash.com/references/personal_tokens

get.description:
Get access list for a project. This is a list of users that have been explictly granted access to the project.
There may be other users that have access to the project via their organization membership.

post.description: Grant a user access to a project

get.description:
Get a project explicit member's access.
There may be users that have access to the project via their organization membership.

NOTE:
We don't use the API on the frontend. Instead, we can call the API
so that we make sure of the user's access to the project.

Create a new one-time passcode for the current user's primary email.
The user will receive an email with the passcode.

get.description:
List the organizations that the current user can join.
This is based on the user's primary email domain and the organization's allowed email domains.

post.description:

This will fail if the organization email domain does not match the user's primary email domain.

get.description: Get login options for email

post.description:
Validate content inside a project. This will start a validation job and return the job id.

Validation jobs scan all charts and dashboards inside a project to find any broken references
to metrics or dimensions that aren't available. Results are available after the job is completed.

parameters.description: the projectId for the validation
parameters.name: projectUuid

requestBody.description: the compiled explores to validate against an existing project, this is used in the CLI to validate a project without creating a preview

schema.description: the compiled explores to validate against an existing project, this is used in the CLI to validate a project without creating a preview

get.description: Get validation results for a project. This will return the results of the latest validation job.

parameters.description: the projectId for the validation
parameters.name: projectUuid

parameters.description: boolean to know if this request is made from the settings page, for analytics
parameters.name: fromSettings

parameters.description: optional jobId to get results for a specific job, used on CLI
parameters.name: jobId

parameters.description: the projectId for the validation
parameters.name: validationId

tags.name: My Account
tags.description: These routes allow users to manage their own user account.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: Each user is a member of a single organization. These routes allow users to manage their organization. Most actions are only available to admin users.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Projects belong to a single organization. These routes allow users to manage their projects, browse content, and execute queries. Users inside an organization might have access to a project from an organization-level role or they might be granted access to a project directly.

tags.name: Spaces
tags.description: Spaces allow you to organize charts and dashboards within a project. They also allow granular access to content by allowing you to create private spaces, which are only accessible to the creator and admins.

tags.name: Roles & Permissions
tags.description: These routes allow users to manage roles and permissions for their organization.
